fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Topos theory plays a central role in geometry and categorical logic. For instance, topoi yield a natural semantic theory of intuitionistic dependent type theories. One important step in this theory is the observation that topoi are Heyting categories, i.e. that propositions in the internal logic of a topos can be refined along intuitionistic predicates. In this talk, I will attempt to give an accessible outline of this classical story and motivate the study of "linear topoi", categories which exhibit topos-like behavior with respect to a linear internal logic. I will conclude with a discussion of some progress towards an axiomatic presentation of these categories.
